001package squidpony.squidgrid.mapping;
002
003import squidpony.annotation.Beta;
004import squidpony.squidai.DijkstraMap;
005import squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.styled.DungeonBoneGen;
006import squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.styled.TilesetType;
007import squidpony.squidmath.LightRNG;
008import squidpony.squidmath.RNG;
009import squidpony.squidgrid.Spill;
010
011import java.awt.*;
012import java.util.ArrayList;
013import java.util.HashMap;
014import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
015
016/**
017 * The primary way to create a more-complete dungeon, layering different effects and modifications on top of
018 * a DungeonBoneGen's dungeon.
019 *
020 * @see squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.DungeonUtility
021 *
022 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
023 * @author Tommy Ettinger - https://github.com/tommyettinger
024 */
025@Beta
026public class DungeonGenerator {
027
028    /**
029     * The effects that can be applied to this dungeon. More may be added in future releases.
030     */
031    public enum FillEffect
032    {
033        /**
034         * Water, represented by '~'
035         */
036        WATER,
037        /**
038         * Doors, represented by '+' for east-to-west connections or '/' for north-to-south ones.
039         */
040        DOORS,
041        /**
042         * Traps, represented by '^'
043         */
044        TRAPS
045    }
046
047    /**
048     * The effects that will be applied when generate is called. Strongly prefer using addWater, addDoors, and addTraps.
049     */
050    public HashMap<FillEffect, Integer> fx;
051    private DungeonBoneGen gen;
052    private int height, width;
053    public RNG rng;
054
055    private char[][] dungeon = null;
056
057    /**
058     * Get the most recently generated char[][] dungeon out of this class, which may be null if none have been
059     * generated with the method generate and setDungeon has not been called.
060     * @return a char[][] dungeon, or null.
061     */
062    public char[][] getDungeon() {
063        return dungeon;
064    }
065
066    /**
067     * Change the underlying char[][]; only affects the toString method, and of course getDungeon.
068     * @param dungeon a char[][], probably produced by an earlier call to this class and then modified.
069     */
070    public void setDungeon(char[][] dungeon) {
071        this.dungeon = dungeon;
072        if(dungeon == null)
073        {
074            width = 0;
075            height = 0;
076            return;
077        }
078        width = dungeon.length;
079        if(width > 0)
080            height = dungeon[0].length;
081    }
082
083    /**
084     * Height of the dungeon in cells.
085     * @return Height of the dungeon in cells.
086     */
087    public int getHeight() {
088        return height;
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * Width of the dungeon in cells.
093     * @return Width of the dungeon in cells.
094     */
095    public int getWidth() {
096        return width;
097    }
098
099
100    /**
101     * Make a DungeonGenerator with a LightRNG using a random seed, height 40, and width 40.
102     */
103    public DungeonGenerator()
104    {
105        rng = new RNG(new LightRNG());
106        gen = new DungeonBoneGen(rng);
107        height = 40;
108        width = 40;
109        fx = new HashMap<FillEffect, Integer>();
110    }
111
112    /**
113     * Make a DungeonGenerator with the given height and width, and the RNG used for generating a dungeon and
114     * adding features will be a LightRNG using a random seed.
115     * @param width The width of the dungeon in cells.
116     * @param height The height of the dungeon in cells.
117     */
118    public DungeonGenerator(int width, int height)
119    {
120        rng = new RNG(new LightRNG());
121        gen = new DungeonBoneGen(rng);
122        this.height = height;
123        this.width = width;
124        fx = new HashMap<FillEffect, Integer>();
125    }
126
127    /**
128     * Make a DungeonGenerator with the given height, width, and RNG. Use this if you want to seed the RNG.
129     * @param width The width of the dungeon in cells.
130     * @param height The height of the dungeon in cells.
131     * @param rng The RNG to use for all purposes in this class; if this has been seeded and you want the same
132     *            results from map generation every time, don't use the same RNG object in other places.
133     */
134    public DungeonGenerator(int width, int height, RNG rng)
135    {
136        this.rng = rng;
137        gen = new DungeonBoneGen(rng);
138        this.height = height;
139        this.width = width;
140        fx = new HashMap<FillEffect, Integer>();
141    }
142
143    /**
144     * Copies all fields from copying and makes a new DungeonGenerator.
145     * @param copying
146     */
147    public DungeonGenerator(DungeonGenerator copying)
148    {
149        rng = new RNG(copying.rng.getRandomness());
150        gen = new DungeonBoneGen(rng);
151        height = copying.height;
152        width = copying.width;
153        fx = new HashMap<FillEffect, Integer>(copying.fx);
154        dungeon = copying.dungeon;
155    }
156
157    /**
158     * Turns the given percentage of floor cells into water cells, represented by '~'. Water will be clustered into
159     * a random number of pools, with more appearing if needed to fill the percentage. Each pool will have randomized
160     * volume that should fill or get very close to filling the requested percentage, unless the pools encounter too
161     * much tight space. If this DungeonGenerator previously had addWater called, the latest call will take precedence.
162     * @param percentage the percentage of floor cells to fill with water; this can vary quite a lot. It may be
163     *                   difficult to fill very high (approaching 100) percentages with water, though it will succeed.
164     * @return this DungeonGenerator; can be chained
165     */
166    public DungeonGenerator addWater(int percentage)
167    {
168        if(percentage < 0) percentage = 0;
169        if(percentage > 100) percentage = 100;
170        if(fx.containsKey(FillEffect.WATER)) fx.remove(FillEffect.WATER);
171        fx.put(FillEffect.WATER, percentage);
172        return this;
173    }
174    /**
175     * Turns the given percentage of viable doorways into doors, represented by '+' for doors that allow travel along
176     * the x-axis and '/' for doors that allow travel along the y-axis. If doubleDoors is true,
177     * 2-cell-wide openings will be considered viable doorways and will fill one cell with a wall, the other a door.
178     * If this DungeonGenerator previously had addDoors called, the latest call will take precedence.
179     * @param percentage the percentage of valid openings to corridors to fill with doors; should be between 10 and
180     *                   20 if you want doors to appear more than a few times, but not fill every possible opening.
181     * @param doubleDoors true if you want two-cell-wide openings to receive a door and a wall; false if only
182     *                    one-cell-wide openings should receive doors. Usually, this should be true.
183     * @return this DungeonGenerator; can be chained
184     */
185    public DungeonGenerator addDoors(int percentage, boolean doubleDoors)
186    {
187        if(percentage < 0) percentage = 0;
188        if(percentage > 100) percentage = 100;
189        if(doubleDoors) percentage *= -1;
190        if(fx.containsKey(FillEffect.DOORS)) fx.remove(FillEffect.DOORS);
191        fx.put(FillEffect.DOORS, percentage);
192        return this;
193    }
194
195    /**
196     * Turns the given percentage of open area floor cells into trap cells, represented by '^'. Corridors that have no
197     * possible way to move around a trap will not receive traps, ever. If this DungeonGenerator previously had
198     * addTraps called, the latest call will take precedence.
199     * @param percentage the percentage of valid cells to fill with traps; should be no higher than 5 unless
200     *                   the dungeon floor is meant to be a kill screen or minefield.
201     * @return this DungeonGenerator; can be chained
202     */
203    public DungeonGenerator addTraps(int percentage)
204    {
205        if(percentage < 0) percentage = 0;
206        if(percentage > 100) percentage = 100;
207        if(fx.containsKey(FillEffect.TRAPS)) fx.remove(FillEffect.TRAPS);
208        fx.put(FillEffect.TRAPS, percentage);
209        return this;
210    }
211
212    /**
213     * Removes any door, water, or trap insertion effects that this DungeonGenerator would put in future dungeons.
214     * @return this DungeonGenerator, with all effects removed. Can be chained.
215     */
216    public DungeonGenerator clearEffects()
217    {
218        fx.clear();
219        return this;
220    }
221
222    private LinkedHashSet<Point> removeAdjacent(LinkedHashSet<Point> coll, Point pt)
223    {
224        for(Point temp : new Point[]{new Point(pt.x+1, pt.y), new Point(pt.x-1, pt.y),
225                new Point(pt.x, pt.y+1), new Point(pt.x, pt.y-1)})
226        {
227            if(coll.contains(temp) && !(temp.x == pt.x && temp.y == pt.y))
228                coll.remove(temp);
229        }
230
231        return coll;
232    }
233    private LinkedHashSet<Point> removeAdjacent(LinkedHashSet<Point> coll, Point pt1, Point pt2)
234    {
235
236        for(Point temp : new Point[]{new Point(pt1.x+1, pt1.y), new Point(pt1.x-1, pt1.y),
237                new Point(pt1.x, pt1.y+1), new Point(pt1.x, pt1.y-1),
238                new Point(pt2.x+1, pt2.y), new Point(pt2.x-1, pt2.y),
239                new Point(pt2.x, pt2.y+1), new Point(pt2.x, pt2.y-1),})
240        {
241            if(coll.contains(temp) && !(temp.x == pt1.x && temp.y == pt1.y) && !(temp.x == pt2.x && temp.y == pt2.y))
242                coll.remove(temp);
243        }
244
245        return coll;
246    }
247
248    private LinkedHashSet<Point> viableDoorways(boolean doubleDoors, char[][] map)
249    {
250        LinkedHashSet<Point> doors = new LinkedHashSet<Point>();
251        Point temp = new Point(0, 0);
252
253        for(int x = 1; x < map.length - 1; x++, temp.x = x) {
254            for (int y = 1; y < map[x].length - 1; y++, temp.y = y) {
255                if(map[x][y] == '#')
256                    continue;
257                if (doubleDoors) {
258                    if (x >= map.length - 2 || y >= map[x].length - 2)
259                        continue;
260                    else {
261                        if (map[x+1][y] != '#' &&
262                                map[x + 2][y] == '#' && map[x - 1][y] == '#'
263                                && map[x][y + 1] != '#' && map[x][y - 1] != '#'
264                                && map[x+1][y + 1] != '#' && map[x+1][y - 1] != '#') {
265                            if (map[x + 2][y + 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y + 1] != '#' || map[x + 2][y - 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y - 1] != '#') {
266                                doors.add(new Point(x, y));
267                                doors.add(new Point(x + 1, y));
268                                doors = removeAdjacent(doors, new Point(x, y), new Point(x + 1, y));
269                                continue;
270                            }
271                        } else if (map[x][y+1] != '#' &&
272                                map[x][y + 2] == '#' && map[x][y - 1] == '#'
273                                && map[x + 1][y] != '#' && map[x - 1][y] != '#'
274                                && map[x + 1][y+1] != '#' && map[x - 1][y+1] != '#') {
275                            if (map[x + 1][y + 2] != '#' || map[x + 1][y - 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y + 2] != '#' || map[x - 1][y - 1] != '#') {
276                                doors.add(new Point(x, y));
277                                doors.add(new Point(x, y+1));
278                                doors = removeAdjacent(doors, new Point(x, y), new Point(x, y+1));
279                                continue;
280                            }
281                        }
282                    }
283                }
284                if (map[x + 1][y] == '#' && map[x - 1][y] == '#' && map[x][y + 1] != '#' && map[x][y - 1] != '#') {
285                    if (map[x + 1][y + 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y + 1] != '#' || map[x + 1][y - 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y - 1] != '#') {
286                        doors.add(new Point(x, y));
287                        doors = removeAdjacent(doors, new Point(x, y));
288                    }
289                } else if (map[x][y + 1] == '#' && map[x][y - 1] == '#' && map[x + 1][y] != '#' && map[x - 1][y] != '#') {
290                    if (map[x + 1][y + 1] != '#' || map[x + 1][y - 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y + 1] != '#' || map[x - 1][y - 1] != '#') {
291                        doors.add(new Point(x, y));
292                        doors = removeAdjacent(doors, new Point(x, y));
293                    }
294                }
295
296            }
297        }
298
299
300        return doors;
301    }
302
303    /**
304     * Generate a char[][] dungeon using TilesetType.DEFAULT_DUNGEON; this produces a dungeon appropriate for a level
305     * of ruins or a partially constructed dungeon. This uses '#' for walls, '.' for floors, '~' for water,
306     * '^' for traps, '+' for doors that provide horizontal passage, and '/' for doors that provide vertical passage.
307     * Use the addDoors, addWater, and addTraps methods of this class to request these in the next generated map.
308     * @return a char[][] dungeon
309     */
310    public char[][] generate() {
311        return generate(TilesetType.DEFAULT_DUNGEON);
312    }
313
314    /**
315     * Generate a char[][] dungeon given a TilesetType; the comments in that class provide some opinions on what
316     * each TilesetType value could be used for in a game. This uses '#' for walls, '.' for floors, '~' for water,
317     * '^' for traps, '+' for doors that provide horizontal passage, and '/' for doors that provide vertical passage.
318     * Use the addDoors, addWater, and addTraps methods of this class to request these in the next generated map.
319     * @see squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.styled.TilesetType
320     * @param kind a TilesetType enum value, such as TilesetType.DEFAULT_DUNGEON
321     * @return a char[][] dungeon
322     */
323    public char[][] generate(TilesetType kind)
324    {
325        DungeonUtility.rng = rng;
326        char[][] map = DungeonBoneGen.wallWrap(gen.generate(kind, width, height));
327        DijkstraMap dijkstra = new DijkstraMap(map);
328        int frustrated = 0;
329        do {
330            dijkstra.setGoal(DungeonUtility.randomFloor(map));
331            dijkstra.scan(null);
332            frustrated++;
333        }while (dijkstra.getMappedCount() < width + height && frustrated < 10);
334        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
335            for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
336                if(dijkstra.gradientMap[i][j] == DijkstraMap.DARK)
337                    map[i][j] = '#';
338            }
339        }
340
341        LinkedHashSet<Point> floors = new LinkedHashSet<Point>();
342        LinkedHashSet<Point> doorways = new LinkedHashSet<Point>();
343        LinkedHashSet<Point> hazards = new LinkedHashSet<Point>();
344        Point temp = new Point(0, 0);
345        boolean doubleDoors = false;
346        int doorFill = 0;
347        int waterFill = 0;
348        int trapFill = 0;
349        if(fx.containsKey(FillEffect.DOORS))
350        {
351            doorFill = fx.get(FillEffect.DOORS);
352            if(doorFill < 0)
353            {
354                doubleDoors = true;
355                doorFill *= -1;
356            }
357        }
358        if(fx.containsKey(FillEffect.WATER)) {
359            waterFill = fx.get(FillEffect.WATER);
360        }
361
362        if(fx.containsKey(FillEffect.TRAPS)) {
363            trapFill = fx.get(FillEffect.TRAPS);
364        }
365
366        doorways = viableDoorways(doubleDoors, map);
367
368        LinkedHashSet<Point> obstacles = new LinkedHashSet<Point>(doorways.size() * doorFill / 100);
369        if(doorFill > 0)
370        {
371            int total = doorways.size() * doorFill / 100;
372
373            BigLoop:
374            for(int i = 0; i < total; i++)
375            {
376                Point entry = (Point) doorways.toArray()[rng.nextInt(doorways.size())];
377                if(map[entry.x - 1][entry.y] != '#' && map[entry.x + 1][entry.y] != '#')
378                {
379                    map[entry.x][entry.y] = '+';
380                }
381                else {
382                    map[entry.x][entry.y] = '/';
383                }
384                obstacles.add(new Point(entry));
385                Point[] adj = new Point[]{new Point(entry.x + 1, entry.y), new Point(entry.x - 1, entry.y),
386                        new Point(entry.x, entry.y + 1), new Point(entry.x, entry.y - 1)};
387                for(Point near : adj) {
388                    if (doorways.contains(near)) {
389                        map[near.x][near.y] = '#';
390                        obstacles.add(new Point(near.x, near.y));
391                        doorways.remove(near);
392                        i++;
393                        doorways.remove(entry);
394                        continue BigLoop;
395                    }
396                }
397                doorways.remove(entry);
398            }
399        }
400
401        for(int x = 1; x < map.length - 1; x++, temp.x = x)
402        {
403            for(int y = 1; y < map[x].length - 1; y++, temp.y = y)
404            {
405                if(map[x][y] == '.' && !obstacles.contains(temp))
406                {
407                    floors.add(new Point(x, y));
408                    int ctr = 0;
409                    if(map[x+1][y] != '#') ++ctr;
410                    if(map[x-1][y] != '#') ++ctr;
411                    if(map[x][y+1] != '#') ++ctr;
412                    if(map[x][y-1] != '#') ++ctr;
413                    if(map[x+1][y+1] != '#') ++ctr;
414                    if(map[x-1][y+1] != '#') ++ctr;
415                    if(map[x+1][y-1] != '#') ++ctr;
416                    if(map[x-1][y-1] != '#') ++ctr;
417                    if(ctr >= 5) hazards.add(new Point(x, y));
418                }
419            }
420        }
421        if(waterFill > 0)
422        {
423            int numPools = rng.nextInt(4) + 2 + waterFill / 20;
424            int[] volumes = new int[numPools];
425            int total = floors.size() * waterFill / 100;
426            int error = 0;
427            for(int i = 0; i < numPools; i++) {
428                volumes[i] = total / numPools;
429                error += volumes[i];
430            }
431            volumes[0] += total - error;
432
433            for(int i = 0; i < numPools; i++) {
434                int r = rng.nextInt(volumes[i] / 2) - volumes[i] / 4;
435                volumes[i] += r;
436                volumes[(i + 1) % numPools] -= r;
437            }
438            Spill spill = new Spill(map, Spill.Measurement.MANHATTAN, rng);
439            int bonusVolume = 0;
440            for(int i = 0; i < numPools; i++)
441            {
442                floors.removeAll(obstacles);
443                Point entry = (Point) floors.toArray()[rng.nextInt(floors.size())];
444//                spill.start(entry, volumes[i] / 3, obstacles);
445//                spill.start(entry, 2 * volumes[i] / 3, obstacles);
446                ArrayList<Point> ordered = new ArrayList<Point>(spill.start(entry, volumes[i], obstacles));
447                floors.removeAll(ordered);
448                hazards.removeAll(ordered);
449                obstacles.addAll(ordered);
450
451                if(spill.filled <= volumes[i])
452                {
453                    bonusVolume += volumes[i] - spill.filled;
454                }
455
456            }
457            for(int x = 1; x < map.length - 1; x++) {
458                for (int y = 1; y < map[x].length - 1; y++) {
459                    if(spill.spillMap[x][y])
460                        map[x][y] = '~';
461                }
462            }
463            int frustration = 0;
464            while (bonusVolume > 0 && frustration < 50)
465            {
466                Point entry = DungeonUtility.randomFloor(map);
467                ArrayList<Point> finisher = spill.start(entry, bonusVolume, obstacles);
468                for(Point p : finisher)
469                {
470                    map[p.x][p.y] = '~';
471                }
472                bonusVolume -= spill.filled;
473                hazards.removeAll(finisher);
474                frustration++;
475            }
476        }
477
478
479
480        if(trapFill > 0)
481        {
482            int total = hazards.size() * trapFill / 100;
483
484            for(int i = 0; i < total; i++)
485            {
486                Point entry = (Point) hazards.toArray()[rng.nextInt(hazards.size())];
487                map[entry.x][entry.y] = '^';
488                hazards.remove(entry);
489            }
490        }
491
492        dungeon = map;
493        return map;
494
495    }
496
497    /**
498     * Provides a string representation of the latest generated dungeon.
499     *
500     * @return
501     */
502    public String toString() {
503        char[][] trans = new char[height][width];
504        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
505            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
506                trans[y][x] = dungeon[x][y];
507            }
508        }
509        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
510        for (int row = 0; row < height; row++) {
511            sb.append(trans[row]);
512            sb.append('\n');
513        }
514        return sb.toString();
515    }
516
517}
